articles.title: Salutations et au revoir en ukrainien : guide complet
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Les salutations sont la porte d'entrÃ©e dans toute conversation. En ukrainien, le choix de la salutation dÃ©pend du moment de la journÃ©e, du niveau de formalitÃ© et de votre relation avec l'interlocuteur.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–Ñ‚"
  translation="Salut"
  pronunciation="pry-VIT"
  context="La salutation informelle la plus courante entre amis, famille et partenaires."
/>

## Salutations informelles

<VocabCard
  word="ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–Ñ‚!"
  translation="Salut !"
  pronunciation="pry-VIT"
  example="La faÃ§on la plus commune de saluer vos proches"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–Ñ‚, ĞºĞ¾Ñ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°/ĞºĞ¾Ñ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹!"
  translation="Salut, chÃ©ri(e) !"
  pronunciation="pry-VIT ko-KHA-na/ko-KHA-nyÃ¯"
  example="ĞšĞ¾Ñ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ° pour une femme, ĞºĞ¾Ñ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ pour un homme"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–Ñ‚, ÑĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ‡ĞºĞ¾!"
  translation="Salut, mon soleil !"
  pronunciation="pry-VIT SO-nÃ©tch-ko"
  example="Terme affectueux trÃ¨s populaire"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ—Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²!"
  translation="Salut ! (masculin, familier)"
  pronunciation="zdo-ROV"
  example="UtilisÃ© surtout entre hommes"
/>

## Salutations formelles

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒ!"
  translation="Bonjour ! (journÃ©e)"
  pronunciation="DO-bryÃ¯ dÃ©n'"
  example="La salutation formelle standard"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğº!"
  translation="Bonjour ! (matin)"
  pronunciation="DO-bryÃ¯ RA-nok"
  example="Jusqu'Ã  environ midi"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²ĞµÑ‡Ñ–Ñ€!"
  translation="Bonsoir !"
  pronunciation="DO-bryÃ¯ VÃ‰-tchir"
  example="Ã€ partir de 17-18h environ"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ’Ñ–Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ!"
  translation="Je vous salue !"
  pronunciation="vi-TA-you"
  example="Salutation respectueuse et chaleureuse"
/>

<CultureTip title="Quand utiliser quelle salutation" flag="ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦">
Avec votre partenaire : Â« ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ–Ñ‚ Â» suffit. Avec ses parents : commencez par Â« Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Â» jusqu'Ã  ce qu'ils vous invitent Ã  Ãªtre moins formel. Le respect des aÃ®nÃ©s est trÃ¨s important dans la culture ukrainienne.
</CultureTip>

## Demander comment Ã§a va

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¯Ğº ÑĞ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸?"
  translation="Comment Ã§a va ?"
  pronunciation="yak SPRA-vy"
  example="La question standard aprÃ¨s la salutation"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¯Ğº Ñ‚Ğ¸?"
  translation="Comment vas-tu ?"
  pronunciation="yak ty"
  example="Version plus courte et informelle"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¯Ğº Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚Ñ‚Ñ?"
  translation="Comment va la vie ?"
  pronunciation="yak jyt-TYA"
  example="Question plus approfondie"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ©Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾?"
  translation="Quoi de neuf ?"
  pronunciation="chtcho no-VO-ho"
  example="Pour demander les nouvelles"
/>

### RÃ©ponses possibles

| Ukrainien | Prononciation | FranÃ§ais |
|-----------|---------------|----------|
| **Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğµ, Ğ´ÑĞºÑƒÑ!** | DO-brÃ© DYA-kou-you | Bien, merci ! |
| **Ğ§ÑƒĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾!** | tchou-DO-vo | Super ! |
| **ĞĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾** | nor-MAL-no | Normal/Ã‡a va |
| **Ğ¢Ğ°Ğº ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ–** | tak so-BI | Comme ci comme Ã§a |
| **ĞĞµ Ğ´ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ** | nÃ© DOU-jÃ© | Pas trÃ¨s bien |

## Au revoir

### Informel

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ‘ÑƒĞ²Ğ°Ğ¹!"
  translation="Salut ! (au revoir)"
  pronunciation="bou-VAÃ"
  example="TrÃ¨s courant entre amis"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ĞŸĞ¾ĞºĞ°!"
  translation="Bye !"
  pronunciation="po-KA"
  example="EmpruntÃ© au russe, trÃ¨s utilisÃ©"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ”Ğ¾ Ğ·ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñ–Ñ‡Ñ–!"
  translation="Ã€ bientÃ´t !"
  pronunciation="do ZOUST-ri-tchi"
  example="LittÃ©ralement Â« jusqu'Ã  la rencontre Â»"
/>

### Formel

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ”Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ!"
  translation="Au revoir !"
  pronunciation="do po-BA-tchen-nya"
  example="La forme standard et polie"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ĞĞ° Ğ²ÑĞµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğµ!"
  translation="Portez-vous bien !"
  pronunciation="na vsÃ© DO-brÃ©"
  example="Souhait chaleureux en partant"
/>

### Romantique

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¦Ñ–Ğ»ÑƒÑ!"
  translation="Je t'embrasse !"
  pronunciation="tsi-LOU-you"
  example="Pour dire au revoir tendrement"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ”Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°, ĞºĞ¾Ñ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°!"
  translation="Ã€ demain, chÃ©rie !"
  pronunciation="do ZAV-tra ko-KHA-na"
  example="Quand vous vous reverrez le lendemain"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¡Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ´ĞºĞ¸Ñ… ÑĞ½Ñ–Ğ²!"
  translation="Fais de beaux rÃªves !"
  pronunciation="so-LOD-kykh sniv"
  example="Pour dire bonne nuit"
/>

<CultureTip title="Les bisous en Ukraine" flag="ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦">
Entre proches, les Ukrainiens se font souvent la bise (gÃ©nÃ©ralement trois fois, en alternant les joues). Entre partenaires, un baiser sur les lÃ¨vres est naturel mÃªme en public. Avec la famille du partenaire, attendez qu'ils initient le contact physique.
</CultureTip>

## Expressions pour diffÃ©rents moments

### Le matin

| Ukrainien | Prononciation | FranÃ§ais |
|-----------|---------------|----------|
| **Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ĞºÑƒ!** | do-BRO-ho RAN-kou | Bonjour (matin) ! |
| **Ğ¯Ğº ÑĞ¿Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ?** | yak SPA-los' | Tu as bien dormi ? |
| **Ğ“Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ½Ñ!** | HAR-no-ho dnya | Bonne journÃ©e ! |

### L'aprÃ¨s-midi

| Ukrainien | Prononciation | FranÃ§ais |
|-----------|---------------|----------|
| **Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒ!** | do-bry-DÃ‰N | Bonjour ! (contraction) |
| **Ğ¯Ğº Ñ‚Ğ²Ñ–Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒ?** | yak tviÃ¯ dÃ©n' | Comment va ta journÃ©e ? |

### Le soir

| Ukrainien | Prononciation | FranÃ§ais |
|-----------|---------------|----------|
| **Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²ĞµÑ‡Ñ–Ñ€!** | DO-bryÃ¯ VÃ‰-tchir | Bonsoir ! |
| **Ğ¯Ğº Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ÑˆĞ¾Ğ² Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒ?** | yak proÃ¯-CHOV dÃ©n' | Comment s'est passÃ©e ta journÃ©e ? |
| **Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ñ–Ñ‡!** | do-bra-NITCH | Bonne nuit ! |

## Expressions affectueuses

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¯ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¹/Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ° Ñ‚ĞµĞ±Ğµ Ğ±Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸!"
  translation="Je suis si content(e) de te voir !"
  pronunciation="ya tak RA-dyÃ¯/RA-da tÃ©-BÃ‰ BA-tchy-ty"
  example="Ğ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¹ (masculin) / Ğ Ğ°Ğ´Ğ° (fÃ©minin)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¢Ğ¸ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ– Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ÑĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ²/ÑĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°!"
  translation="Tu m'as tellement manquÃ©(e) !"
  pronunciation="ty mÃ©-NI tak SKOU-tchyv/SKOU-tchy-la"
  example="Ğ¡ĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ² (masculin) / Ğ¡ĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ° (fÃ©minin)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ĞĞµ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñƒ Ğ· Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‰Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑÑ"
  translation="Je ne veux pas te dire au revoir"
  pronunciation="nÃ© KHO-tchou z to-BO-you pro-CHTCHA-ty-sya"
  example="Expression romantique de sÃ©paration"
/>

## FÃ©licitations et souhaits

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ’Ñ–Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ!"
  translation="FÃ©licitations !"
  pronunciation="vi-TA-you"
  example="Pour tout type de fÃ©licitations"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ— Ğ´Ğ½ĞµĞ¼ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ!"
  translation="Joyeux anniversaire !"
  pronunciation="z dnÃ©m na-RO-djÃ©n-nya"
  example="Pour les anniversaires"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ—Ñ– ÑĞ²ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼!"
  translation="Bonne fÃªte !"
  pronunciation="zi SVYA-tom"
  example="Pour toute cÃ©lÃ©bration"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¡Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾!"
  translation="Bon appÃ©tit !"
  pronunciation="SMATCH-no-ho"
  example="Avant les repas"
/>

<CTA />

articles.title: Grammatica Turca per Principianti: Impara a Comunicare con il Tuo Partner
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Immagina di guardare il tuo partner turco negli occhi e riuscire finalmente a esprimere i tuoi sentimenti nella sua lingua. La grammatica turca puÃ² sembrare intimidatoria all'inizio, ma con le basi giuste Ã¨ un po' di pratica insieme, scoprirai quanto Ã¨ semplice creare connessioni autentiche. Entro la fine di questa guida, sarai in grado di costruire frasi romantiche e tenere conversazioni basiche con il tuo amore!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Seni seviyorum"
  translation="Ti amo"
  pronunciation="SEH-nee seh-vee-YOHR-uhm"
  context="La frase piÃ¹ importante che potrai mai dire al tuo partner turco."
/>

## La Spiegazione Semplice: Come Funziona il Turco

Il turco Ã¨ una lingua logica e regolare - pensa ad essa come a costruire con mattoncini LEGO. Ogni blocco ha il suo posto Ã¨ una volta che capisci dove vanno, puoi creare qualsiasi cosa! A differenza dell'italiano, il turco utilizza suffissi (piccole aggiunte alla fine delle parole) per mostrare chi fa l'azione, quando la fa, e altre informazioni. Ãˆ come se ogni parola portasse con sÃ© il suo piccolo biglietto da visita!

## Le 5 Regole Base (Che Ti Serviranno Ogni Giorno)

1. **I verbi vanno alla fine** - In turco la struttura Ã¨: Soggetto + Oggetto + Verbo
   - *Io amo te* diventa *Ben seni seviyorum*

2. **Non ci sono articoli** - Non esistono "il", "lo", "la". Il contesto ti dice se Ã¨ specifico o generico

3. **Le vocali si armonizzano** - Le vocali in un suffisso cambiano per suonare bene con la parola base
   - *Ev* (casa) + *-de* (in) = *Evde* (in casa)
   - *Okul* (scuola) + *-de* (in) = *Okulda* (a scuola)

4. **I pronomi sono opzionali** - Il verbo giÃ  dice chi fa l'azione
   - *Geliyorum* significa giÃ  "Io vengo" - non serve dire *Ben geliyorum*

5. **Un suffisso = un concetto** - Ogni aggiunta ha un significato preciso
   - *-de/-da* = in/su
   - *-den/-dan* = da/di

<VocabCard
  word="Geliyorum"
  translation="Sto venendo"
  pronunciation="geh-lee-YOHR-uhm"
  example="Sana geliyorum - Sto venendo da te"
/>

## Esempi per Coppie: Vocabolario Romantico

| Turco | Italiano | Pronuncia | Nota Grammaticale |
|--------|-----------|---------------|-------------------|
| **Seni Ã¶pÃ¼yorum** | Ti sto baciando | SEH-nee uh-poo-YOHR-uhm | Presente continuo |
| **Seni Ã¶zledim** | Mi sei mancato/a | SEH-nee uh-zleh-DEEM | Passato semplice |
| **Seni dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼yorum** | Sto pensando a te | SEH-nee doo-shoo-nee-YOHR-uhm | Presente continuo |
| **YanÄ±mda ol** | Stai accanto a me | yah-NIM-dah ohl | Imperativo |
| **Sensiz olmuyor** | Non funziona senza di te | SEHN-seez ohl-moo-YOHR | Negazione |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡·" title="Espressioni di Affetto">
In Turchia, le coppie usano spesso "canÄ±m" (il mio tesoro) e "aÅŸkÄ±m" (il mio amore) come aggettivi possessivi. Ãˆ completamente normale sentire "CanÄ±m karÄ±m" (mia cara moglie) o "AÅŸkÄ±m kocam" (mio amato marito)!
</CultureTip>

## Coniugazione dei Verbi Essenziali

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Sevmek"
  meaning="amare"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Io", word: "seviyorum", translation: "io amo" },
    { person: "Tu", word: "seviyorsun", translation: "tu ami" },
    { person: "Lui/Lei", word: "seviyor", translation: "lui/lei ama" },
    { person: "Noi", word: "seviyoruz", translation: "noi amiamo" },
    { person: "Voi", word: "seviyorsunuz", translation: "voi amate" },
    { person: "Loro", word: "seviyorlar", translation: "loro amano" }
  ]}
/>

### Verbi Comuni nella Vita Quotidiana

- **Gelmek** (venire) - geh-LEHM
- **Gitmek** (andare) - geet-MEHM
- **Yemek** (mangiare) - yeh-MEHM
- **Ä°Ã§mek** (bere) - eech-MEHM
- **KonuÅŸmak** (parlare) - koh-nosh-MAHK
- **Dinlemek** (ascoltare) - deen-leh-MEHM

<VocabCard
  word="AnlÄ±yorum"
  translation="Capisco"
  pronunciation="ahn-lee-YOHR-uhm"
  example="Seni anlÄ±yorum - Ti capisco"
/>

## Frasi per Praticare: Scenari Romantici

1. **BugÃ¼n ne yapÄ±yorsun?** - Cosa fai oggi? (boo-GOON neh yah-puh-YOHR-soon)
2. **AkÅŸam yemeÄŸe Ã§Ä±kalÄ±m mÄ±?** - Usciamo a cena stasera? (ahk-SHAHM yeh-meh-eh chih-kah-LEEM muh)
3. **Seni Ã§ok Ã¶zledim** - Mi sei mancato/a tantissimo (SEH-nee CHOKE uh-zleh-DEEM)
4. **Benimle evlenir misin?** - Vuoi sposarmi? (beh-NEEM-leh ev-leh-NEER meh-SEEN)
5. **HayatÄ±m sensiz anlamsÄ±z** - La mia vita non ha senso senza di te (hah-yah-TEEM SEHN-seez ahn-LAHM-suhz)
6. **Her zaman yanÄ±ndayÄ±m** - Sono sempre accanto a te (hehr zah-MAHN yah-NEEN-dah-yuhm)
7. **Seni dÃ¼nyalar kadar seviyorum** - Ti amo piÃ¹ di tutti i mondi (SEH-nee doon-yah-LAHR kah-DAHR seh-vee-YOHR-uhm)

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡·" title="Espressioni del Giorno">
In Turchia, Ã¨ comune usare metafore naturali per esprimere amore: "gÃ¼neÅŸim" (mio sole), "ayÄ±m" (mia luna), "yÄ±ldÄ±zÄ±m" (mia stella). Prova a chiamare il tuo partner "gÃ¼neÅŸim" al tramonto per un momento speciale!
</CultureTip>

## Errori Comuni da Evitare

| âŒ Errato | âœ… Corretto | PerchÃ© |
|-----------|--------------|---------|
| *Ben seni seviyor* | **Ben seni seviyorum** | Il verbo deve concordare con il soggetto |
| *Benim adÄ±m Ã¨* | **Benim adÄ±m** | Non serve il verbo "essere" per presentarsi |
| *TÃ¼rkÃ§e bilmiyor* | **TÃ¼rkÃ§e bilmiyorum** | Manca la desinenza personale |
| *Seni seviyorsun* | **Seni seviyorum** | Stai dicendo "tu mi ami" invece di "io ti amo" |
| *Ä°stanbul gitmek* | **Ä°stanbul'a gitmek** | Manca il caso dativo (-a/-e) |

## Quadro di Riferimento Rapido

### Suffissi Essenziali
- **-yorum** = sto... (presente continuo)
- **-dim** = ho... (passato)
- **-eceÄŸim** = verrÃ²/andrÃ² (futuro)
- **-de/-da** = in/su (locativo)
- **-den/-dan** = da/di (ablativo)
- **-e/-a** = a/per (dativo)

### Pronomi Possessivi
- **-(Ä±)m** = mio/mia
- **-(Ä±)n** = tuo/tua
- **-(s)Ä±** = suo/sua

Per approfondire il tuo vocabolario romantico, dai un'occhiata alla nostra guida su [come dire ti amo in turco](/learn/it/tr/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-turkish/) e scopri [i nomignoli turchi piÃ¹ dolci per il tuo partner](/learn/it/tr/turkish-pet-names-for-your-partner/).

## Prossimi Passi nel Tuo Viaggio

Ora che conosci le basi, sei pronto per:
- Esplorare [le frasi essenziali per coppie](/learn/it/tr/essential-turkish-phrases-for-couples/)
- Imparare i [saluti e i arrivederci turci](/learn/it/tr/turkish-greetings-and-farewells/)
- Prepararti a [conoscere la famiglia del tuo partner turco](/learn/it/tr/meeting-your-turkish-partners-family/)

Ricorda: la grammatica Ã¨ solo lo scheletro della lingua - l'amore che ci metti quando parli con il tuo partner Ã¨ ciÃ² che davvero conta. Pratica insieme, sbaglia con sorriso e celebra ogni piccolo progresso!

<CTA />

articles.title: Argot grec pour SMS : communiquez avec votre partenaire
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Votre partenaire grec/grecque vous envoie des messages mysterieux ? Decouvrez le langage des SMS grecs !

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="sa-ga-PO"
  context="Souvent ecrit ÏƒÎ±Î³Î±Ï€Ï‰ ou sagapw en Greeklish."
/>

## Le Greeklish

Les Grecs ecrivent souvent en alphabet latin (Greeklish) dans les textos.

<VocabCard
  word="Greeklish"
  translation="Grec ecrit en lettres latines"
  pronunciation="GRIK-lich"
  example="Comme ecrire 'sagapo' au lieu de 'Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï'"
/>

### Alphabet de conversion

| Grec | Latin | Exemple |
|------|-------|---------|
| Î± | a | Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î· â†’ agapi |
| Î¸ | th | Î¸Î­Î»Ï‰ â†’ thelo |
| Ï‡ | x ou h | Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¬ â†’ xara |
| Ï‰ | w ou o | ÎºÎ±Î»Ï â†’ kalo |
| Ïˆ | ps | ÏˆÏ‰Î¼Î¯ â†’ psomi |

<CultureTip title="Pourquoi le Greeklish ?" flag="ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·">
Avant les smartphones avec claviers grecs, les Grecs utilisaient l'alphabet latin pour ecrire. Aujourd'hui, beaucoup continuent par habitude ou pour aller plus vite. Votre partenaire peut alterner entre les deux !
</CultureTip>

## Abreviations essentielles

### Salutations

<VocabCard
  word="Î“ÎµÎ¹Î± / geia"
  translation="Salut"
  pronunciation="YA"
  example="Forme abregee de Î“ÎµÎ¹Î± ÏƒÎ¿Ï…"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ÎšÎ±Î»Î·Î¼Î­ÏÎ± / kalimera"
  translation="Bonjour (matin)"
  pronunciation="ka-li-ME-ra"
  example="Souvent abregee en 'klm'"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ÎšÎ±Î»Î·Î½ÏÏ‡Ï„Î± / kalinixta"
  translation="Bonne nuit"
  pronunciation="ka-li-NIH-ta"
  example="Abregee en 'kln'"
/>

### Reponses courtes

| Abreviation | Signification | Francais |
|-------------|---------------|----------|
| **ok / Î¿Îº** | Î•Î½Ï„Î¬Î¾ÎµÎ¹ | OK |
| **Î½Î±Î¹ / nai** | ÎÎ±Î¹ | Oui |
| **Î¿Ï‡Î¹ / oxi** | ÎŒÏ‡Î¹ | Non |
| **tnx / ÎµÏ…Ï‡** | Î•Ï…Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¹ÏƒÏ„Ï | Merci |
| **Ï„Ï€Ï„ / tpt** | Î¤Î¯Ï€Î¿Ï„Î± | De rien |
| **Îº / k** | ÎšÎ±Î¹ | Et |

## Expressions romantiques par texto

<VocabCard
  word="Î‘Î³Î¬Ï€Î· Î¼Î¿Ï… / agapi mou"
  translation="Mon amour"
  pronunciation="a-GA-pi mou"
  example="Surnom affectueux classique"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï / sagapo"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="sa-ga-PO"
  example="L'expression essentielle"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ÎœÎ¿Ï… Î»ÎµÎ¯Ï€ÎµÎ¹Ï‚ / mou lipis"
  translation="Tu me manques"
  pronunciation="mou LI-pis"
  example="Pour exprimer le manque"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Î¦Î¹Î»Î¬ÎºÎ¹Î± / filakia"
  translation="Bisous"
  pronunciation="fi-LA-kia"
  example="Pour terminer un message"
/>

### Petits noms

| Grec | Greeklish | Francais |
|------|-----------|----------|
| **ÎœÏ‰ÏÏŒ Î¼Î¿Ï…** | moro mou | Mon bebe |
| **Î–Ï‰Î® Î¼Î¿Ï…** | zoi mou | Ma vie |
| **ÎšÎ±ÏÎ´Î¹Î¬ Î¼Î¿Ï…** | kardia mou | Mon cÅ“ur |
| **Î“Î»Ï…ÎºÎ¹Î¬/ÏŒÏ‚ Î¼Î¿Ï…** | glykia/os mou | Mon/Ma doux/douce |
| **Î‘ÏƒÏ„Î­ÏÎ¹ Î¼Î¿Ï…** | asteri mou | Mon etoile |

<CultureTip title="ÎœÏ‰ÏÏŒ Î¼Î¿Ï…" flag="ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·">
Â« ÎœÏ‰ÏÏŒ Î¼Î¿Ï… Â» (mon bebe) est trÃ¨s courant entre couples grecs, mÃªme pour des adultes. C'est affectueux, pas infantilisant. Votre partenaire l'utilisera probablement souvent !
</CultureTip>

## Questions et reponses par texto

<VocabCard
  word="Î Î¿Ï ÎµÎ¯ÏƒÎ±Î¹; / pou ise"
  translation="T'es oÃ¹ ?"
  pronunciation="pou I-sÃ©"
  example="Question classique"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Î¤Î¹ ÎºÎ¬Î½ÎµÎ¹Ï‚; / ti kanis"
  translation="Tu fais quoi ?"
  pronunciation="ti KA-nis"
  example="Pour prendre des nouvelles"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Î ÏŒÏ„Îµ Î¸Î± Î­ÏÎ¸ÎµÎ¹Ï‚; / pote tha erthis"
  translation="Tu arrives quand ?"
  pronunciation="PO-tÃ© tha ER-this"
  example="Pour les rendez-vous"
/>

### Reponses typiques

| Question | Reponse | Signification |
|----------|---------|---------------|
| Î Î¿Ï ÎµÎ¯ÏƒÎ±Î¹; | Î£Ï€Î¯Ï„Î¹ / spiti | A la maison |
| Î¤Î¹ ÎºÎ¬Î½ÎµÎ¹Ï‚; | Î¤Ï€Ï„ / tpt | Rien de special |
| Î ÏÏ‚ ÎµÎ¯ÏƒÎ±Î¹; | ÎšÎ±Î»Î¬ / kala | Ca va |

## Argot courant

<VocabCard
  word="Î¤Î­Î»ÎµÎ¹Î¿ / telio"
  translation="Parfait / Super"
  pronunciation="TE-lio"
  example="Expression d'approbation"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Î¦Î¿Î²ÎµÏÏŒ / fovero"
  translation="Genial / Incroyable"
  pronunciation="fo-vÃ©-RO"
  example="Litteralement : terrible"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Î§Î±Î»Î±ÏÎ¬ / xalara"
  translation="Cool / Tranquille"
  pronunciation="ha-la-RA"
  example="Pour dire que tout va bien"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ÎœÎ±Î»Î±ÎºÎ¯ÎµÏ‚ / malakies"
  translation="N'importe quoi (familier)"
  pronunciation="ma-la-KI-Ã©s"
  example="Attention, assez vulgaire !"
/>

## Mini-conversation type

```
- Î“ÎµÎ¹Î± Î¼Ï‰ÏÏŒ Î¼Î¿Ï…! Î¤Î¹ ÎºÎ¬Î½ÎµÎ¹Ï‚;
- Î“ÎµÎ¹Î± Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î·! ÎšÎ±Î»Î¬, ÎµÏƒÏ;
- ÎœÎ¿Ï… Î»ÎµÎ¯Ï€ÎµÎ¹Ï‚ ğŸ˜˜
- ÎšÎ¹ ÎµÎ¼Î­Î½Î±! Î ÏŒÏ„Îµ Î¸Î± Î²ÏÎµÎ¸Î¿ÏÎ¼Îµ;
- Î‘Ï€ÏŒÏˆÎµ;
- Î¤Î­Î»ÎµÎ¹Î¿! Î¤Î¹ ÏÏÎ±;
- Î£Ï„Î¹Ï‚ 8;
- ÎŸÎº! Î‘Î½Ï…Ï€Î¿Î¼Î¿Î½Ï
- ÎšÎ¹ ÎµÎ³Ï! Î¦Î¹Î»Î¬ÎºÎ¹Î±!
- â¤ï¸
```

<CultureTip title="Les appels video" flag="ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·">
Les Grecs adorent les appels video, surtout les generationels plus Ã¢gees. Votre partenaire pourrait preferer un appel video rapide Ã  un long echange de textos. Viber et WhatsApp sont trÃ¨s populaires en GrÃ¨ce.
</CultureTip>

## Emojis populaires

| Emoji | Signification en Grece |
|-------|----------------------|
| â¤ï¸ | Amour classique |
| ğŸ’™ | Souvent utilise (couleur grecque) |
| ğŸ˜˜ | Bisou |
| ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡· | Fierte nationale |
| ğŸ¥° | Amoureux |

## En cas de dispute

<VocabCard
  word="Î£Ï…Î³Î³Î½ÏÎ¼Î· / signomi"
  translation="Pardon"
  pronunciation="sin-GNO-mi"
  example="Pour s'excuser"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ÎœÎ·Î½ Î¸Ï…Î¼ÏÎ½ÎµÎ¹Ï‚ / min thimoneis"
  translation="Ne te fÃ¢che pas"
  pronunciation="min thi-MO-nis"
  example="Pour calmer"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Î‘Ï‚ Ï„Î± Î²ÏÎ¿ÏÎ¼Îµ / as ta vroume"
  translation="Reconcilions-nous"
  pronunciation="as ta VROU-mÃ©"
  example="Proposer la paix"
/>

<CTA />

articles.title: Czech Daily Conversations for Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Living with a Czech partner means plenty of daily opportunities to practice the language. This guide covers all the essential phrases you'll need from morning coffee to goodnight kisses.

## Start the Day Right

<PhraseOfDay
  word="DobrÃ© rÃ¡no, lÃ¡sko"
  translation="Good morning, love"
  pronunciation="DOB-re RA-no, LAS-ko"
  context="The sweetest way to start each day with your Czech partner."
/>

### Morning Greetings

<VocabCard
  word="Jak ses vyspal/vyspala?"
  translation="How did you sleep? (m/f)"
  pronunciation="Yak ses VIS-pal / VIS-pa-la?"
  example="Ask your partner about their night."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Spal/Spala jsem dobÅ™e"
  translation="I slept well (m/f)"
  pronunciation="Spal/SPA-la sem DOB-rzhe"
  example="Responding to the question."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="MÄ›l/MÄ›la jsem krÃ¡snÃ½ sen"
  translation="I had a beautiful dream (m/f)"
  pronunciation="Myel/MYE-la sem KRAS-nee sen"
  example="Share your dreams!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="DÃ¡Å¡ si kÃ¡vu?"
  translation="Would you like coffee?"
  pronunciation="Dash si KA-vu?"
  example="Offer your partner their morning drink."
/>

<CultureTip title="Czech Morning Routine" flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿">
Czechs typically start the day with a strong coffee. Breakfast is often simple - bread with butter and jam, or yogurt. Taking time for morning coffee together is a cherished ritual for many Czech couples.
</CultureTip>

## Breakfast Time

<VocabCard
  word="Co si dÃ¡Å¡ k snÃ­dani?"
  translation="What will you have for breakfast?"
  pronunciation="Tso si dash k SNEE-da-nyi?"
  example="Planning breakfast together."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="MÃ¡m hlad"
  translation="I'm hungry"
  pronunciation="Mam hlat"
  example="Express your hunger."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="UdÄ›lÃ¡m ti snÃ­dani"
  translation="I'll make you breakfast"
  pronunciation="U-DYEL-am ti SNEE-da-nyi"
  example="A sweet morning gesture."
/>

| Czech | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Chleba** | KHLEB-a | Bread |
| **MÃ¡slo** | MAS-lo | Butter |
| **DÅ¾em** | dzhem | Jam |
| **Vejce** | VEY-tse | Eggs |
| **Jogurt** | YO-gurt | Yogurt |
| **KÃ¡va** | KA-va | Coffee |
| **ÄŒaj** | chai | Tea |

## Leaving for Work

<VocabCard
  word="MusÃ­m jÃ­t do prÃ¡ce"
  translation="I have to go to work"
  pronunciation="MU-seem yeet do PRA-tse"
  example="Time to leave."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="V kolik budeÅ¡ doma?"
  translation="What time will you be home?"
  pronunciation="F KO-lik BU-desh DO-ma?"
  example="Planning your evening."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Budu doma kolem Å¡estÃ©"
  translation="I'll be home around six"
  pronunciation="BU-du DO-ma KO-lem SHES-te"
  example="Answering the question."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="MÄ›j se hezky"
  translation="Have a nice day"
  pronunciation="Myey se HEZ-ki"
  example="A sweet farewell."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="BudeÅ¡ mi chybÄ›t"
  translation="I'll miss you"
  pronunciation="BU-desh mi KHI-byet"
  example="Express affection before parting."
/>

## During the Day - Texting

<VocabCard
  word="Jak ti jde den?"
  translation="How's your day going?"
  pronunciation="Yak ti de den?"
  example="Check in with your partner."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="MyslÃ­m na tebe"
  translation="I'm thinking of you"
  pronunciation="MIS-leem na TE-be"
  example="A sweet midday message."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="TÄ›Å¡Ã­m se na tebe"
  translation="I'm looking forward to seeing you"
  pronunciation="TYE-sheem se na TE-be"
  example="Express anticipation."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Co bys chtÄ›l/chtÄ›la k veÄeÅ™i?"
  translation="What would you like for dinner? (m/f)"
  pronunciation="Tso bis KHTYEL / KHTYE-la k VE-che-rzhi?"
  example="Plan dinner together."
/>

<CultureTip title="Czech Work Culture" flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿">
Czechs typically work standard 8-hour days and value their free time. It's common to have lunch as the main meal of the day. Many Czechs bring food from home or eat at workplace cafeterias (jÃ­delna).
</CultureTip>

## Coming Home

<VocabCard
  word="Jsem doma!"
  translation="I'm home!"
  pronunciation="Sem DO-ma!"
  example="Announce your arrival."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jak bylo v prÃ¡ci?"
  translation="How was work?"
  pronunciation="Yak BI-lo f PRA-tsi?"
  example="Ask about their day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bylo to nÃ¡roÄnÃ©"
  translation="It was demanding/tiring"
  pronunciation="BI-lo to NA-roch-ne"
  example="Share about a hard day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="PojÄ, dÃ¡m ti pusu"
  translation="Come here, I'll give you a kiss"
  pronunciation="Poy, dam ti PU-su"
  example="Welcome your partner home."
/>

## Evening Routine

### Dinner Time

<VocabCard
  word="VeÄeÅ™e je hotovÃ¡"
  translation="Dinner is ready"
  pronunciation="VE-che-rzhe ye HO-to-va"
  example="Call your partner to eat."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dobrou chuÅ¥"
  translation="Enjoy your meal"
  pronunciation="DOB-row khut"
  example="Say before eating."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je to vÃ½bornÃ©!"
  translation="It's delicious!"
  pronunciation="Ye to VEE-bor-ne!"
  example="Compliment the cooking."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Umyji nÃ¡dobÃ­"
  translation="I'll wash the dishes"
  pronunciation="U-MI-yi NA-do-bee"
  example="Offer to help clean up."
/>

### Relaxing Together

<VocabCard
  word="Co budeme dÄ›lat veÄer?"
  translation="What shall we do this evening?"
  pronunciation="Tso BU-de-me DYE-lat VE-cher?"
  example="Plan your evening."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="PodÃ­vÃ¡me se na film?"
  translation="Shall we watch a movie?"
  pronunciation="PO-dee-va-me se na film?"
  example="Suggest a movie night."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="PojÄ si se mnou sednout"
  translation="Come sit with me"
  pronunciation="Poy si se mnow SED-nowt"
  example="Invite closeness."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="MÅ¯Å¾eme si jen tak povÃ­dat"
  translation="We can just talk"
  pronunciation="MOO-zhe-me si yen tak PO-vee-dat"
  example="Quality time together."
/>

<CultureTip title="Czech Evening Habits" flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿">
Czech couples often enjoy spending evenings at home. Popular activities include watching TV, going for walks (prochÃ¡zka), or visiting local pubs (hospoda) together. Sunday dinner with family is also a cherished tradition.
</CultureTip>

## Household Tasks

<VocabCard
  word="MÅ¯Å¾eÅ¡ mi pomoct?"
  translation="Can you help me?"
  pronunciation="MOO-zhesh mi PO-motst?"
  example="Ask for assistance."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="MusÃ­m uklidit"
  translation="I need to clean"
  pronunciation="MU-seem U-kli-dit"
  example="Household chores."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="PÅ¯jdu na nÃ¡kup"
  translation="I'll go shopping"
  pronunciation="POO-du na NA-kup"
  example="Running errands."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="PotÅ™ebujeme..."
  translation="We need..."
  pronunciation="PO-trzhe-bu-ye-me..."
  example="Making a shopping list."
/>

| Czech | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **PrÃ¡t** | prat | To do laundry |
| **Luxovat** | LU-xo-vat | To vacuum |
| **VaÅ™it** | VA-rzhit | To cook |
| **MÃ½t nÃ¡dobÃ­** | meet NA-do-bee | To wash dishes |
| **UklÃ­zet** | U-klee-zet | To clean up |

## Weekend Plans

<VocabCard
  word="Co budeme dÄ›lat o vÃ­kendu?"
  translation="What shall we do this weekend?"
  pronunciation="Tso BU-de-me DYE-lat o VEE-ken-du?"
  example="Plan your weekend."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="PÅ¯jdeme nÄ›kam ven?"
  translation="Shall we go out somewhere?"
  pronunciation="POO-de-me NYE-kam ven?"
  example="Suggest going out."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mohli bychom..."
  translation="We could..."
  pronunciation="MO-hli BI-khom..."
  example="Make suggestions."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="To znÃ­ skvÄ›le!"
  translation="That sounds great!"
  pronunciation="To znee SKVYE-le!"
  example="Agree enthusiastically."
/>

## Bedtime

<VocabCard
  word="Jsem unavenÃ½/unavenÃ¡"
  translation="I'm tired (m/f)"
  pronunciation="Sem U-na-ve-nee / U-na-ve-na"
  example="Express tiredness."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="PÅ¯jdeme spÃ¡t?"
  translation="Shall we go to bed?"
  pronunciation="POO-de-me spat?"
  example="Suggest bedtime."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dobrou noc, lÃ¡sko"
  translation="Good night, love"
  pronunciation="DOB-row nots, LAS-ko"
  example="Say goodnight sweetly."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Spi dobÅ™e"
  translation="Sleep well"
  pronunciation="Spi DOB-rzhe"
  example="Wish them good sleep."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="HezkÃ© sny"
  translation="Sweet dreams"
  pronunciation="HEZ-ke sni"
  example="Before falling asleep."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Miluji tÄ›"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="MI-lu-yi tye"
  example="The perfect way to end the day."
/>

## Quick Reference: Daily Phrases

### Morning
| Czech | English |
|-------|---------|
| DobrÃ© rÃ¡no | Good morning |
| Jak ses vyspal/a? | How did you sleep? |
| DÃ¡Å¡ si kÃ¡vu? | Want coffee? |
| MÄ›j se hezky | Have a nice day |

### During the Day
| Czech | English |
|-------|---------|
| MyslÃ­m na tebe | Thinking of you |
| Jak ti jde den? | How's your day? |
| TÄ›Å¡Ã­m se na tebe | Looking forward to seeing you |
| V kolik budeÅ¡ doma? | What time will you be home? |

### Evening
| Czech | English |
|-------|---------|
| Jsem doma | I'm home |
| Jak bylo v prÃ¡ci? | How was work? |
| Dobrou chuÅ¥ | Enjoy your meal |
| Co budeme dÄ›lat? | What shall we do? |

### Night
| Czech | English |
|-------|---------|
| Jsem unavenÃ½/Ã¡ | I'm tired |
| Dobrou noc | Good night |
| Spi dobÅ™e | Sleep well |
| Miluji tÄ› | I love you |

<CTA />

articles.title: Prononciation danoise : guide complet pour francophones
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Le danois est repute pour sa prononciation difficile. Mais avec les bonnes explications, vous pouvez y arriver !

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Jeg elsker dig"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="yay EL-sker day"
  context="Le 'g' de 'jeg' est souvent muet, et le 'd' de 'dig' se prononce comme un 'y' doux."
/>

## Les voyelles danoises

Le danois a de nombreuses voyelles, dont certaines trÃ¨s particuliÃ¨res.

### Les voyelles familieres

| Voyelle | Prononciation | Exemple |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **A** | comme en franÃ§ais | kat (chat) |
| **E** | Ã¨ ou Ã© | lese (lire) |
| **I** | comme en franÃ§ais | vi (nous) |
| **O** | ou ou o | bror (frÃ¨re) |
| **U** | ou arrondi | hund (chien) |

### Les voyelles speciales

<VocabCard
  word="Ã…"
  translation="Se prononce 'o' ouvert"
  pronunciation="o"
  example="Ã…r (annee) - comme 'or' en franÃ§ais"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ã†"
  translation="Se prononce 'Ã¨'"
  pronunciation="Ã¨"
  example="VÃ¦re (Ãªtre) - comme 'faire'"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ã˜"
  translation="Se prononce 'eu'"
  pronunciation="eu"
  example="Ã˜l (biÃ¨re) - comme 'feu'"
/>

<CultureTip title="Ã†, Ã˜, Ã…" flag="ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°">
Ces trois lettres sont des lettres Ã  part entiÃ¨re de l'alphabet danois ! Elles viennent aprÃ¨s Z. Les maitriser est essentiel pour Ãªtre compris.
</CultureTip>

## Le celebre 'stÃ¸d'

<VocabCard
  word="StÃ¸d"
  translation="Coup de glotte"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="Une coupure dans la voix, comme dans 'oh-oh' en franÃ§ais"
/>

Le Â« stÃ¸d Â» est une coupure glottale qui peut changer le sens des mots. C'est le son qu'on fait quand on dit Â« oh-oh Â» pour exprimer la surprise.

<CultureTip title="Le stÃ¸d" flag="ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°">
Le stÃ¸d est ce qui rend le danois si difficile Ã  prononcer ! Mais ne vous inquietez pas - les Danois vous comprendront mÃªme sans stÃ¸d parfait. Cela viendra avec la pratique.
</CultureTip>

## Les consonnes speciales

### Le 'D' mou

<VocabCard
  word="D apres voyelle"
  translation="Se prononce comme 'th' anglais ou disparait"
  pronunciation="(th doux)"
  example="Mad (nourriture) = 'math' doux"
/>

Le 'd' danois aprÃ¨s une voyelle est trÃ¨s doux, presque comme le 'th' anglais dans Â« the Â», ou il disparait completement.

### Le 'G' muet

<VocabCard
  word="G final ou avant consonne"
  translation="Souvent muet"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="Dag (jour) = 'da'"
/>

### Le 'R' danois

<VocabCard
  word="R"
  translation="R guttural/grasseye"
  pronunciation="r guttural"
  example="Proche du R franÃ§ais mais plus doux"
/>

### Combinaisons difficiles

| Combinaison | Prononciation | Exemple |
|-------------|---------------|---------|
| **HV** | v | hvad (quoi) = 'va' |
| **HJ** | y | hjerte (cÅ“ur) = 'yÃ¨r-te' |
| **SJ** | ch | sjov (drÃ´le) = 'chou' |
| **ND** | n (d muet) | hund (chien) = 'hun' |

<CultureTip title="Le danois 'avale' les sons" flag="ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°">
Une blague dit que les Danois parlent comme s'ils avaient une pomme de terre chaude dans la bouche ! Beaucoup de consonnes sont adoucies ou disparaissent. C'est normal et fait partie du charme du danois.
</CultureTip>

## Pratiquer avec des mots romantiques

<VocabCard
  word="KÃ¦rlighed"
  translation="Amour"
  pronunciation="CHÃˆR-li-hÃ¨d"
  example="Le 'Ã¦' se prononce 'Ã¨', le 'd' final est doux"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hjerte"
  translation="CÅ“ur"
  pronunciation="YÃˆR-te"
  example="Le 'hj' se prononce 'y'"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ã˜jne"
  translation="Yeux"
  pronunciation="EU-ne"
  example="Ã˜ se prononce 'eu'"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Smuk"
  translation="Belle"
  pronunciation="smouk"
  example="Le 'u' se prononce 'ou'"
/>

## Pieges de prononciation

### Le 'D' dans differentes positions

<VocabCard
  word="D initial"
  translation="Se prononce normalement"
  pronunciation="d"
  example="Dag = 'da' (le g est muet, pas le d)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="D apres voyelle"
  translation="TrÃ¨s doux ou muet"
  pronunciation="(th doux)"
  example="Mad = 'math' doux"
/>

### Les voyelles qui disparaissent

<VocabCard
  word="Voyelles finales"
  translation="Souvent tres reduites"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="Les terminaisons sont souvent avalees"
/>

## Phrases Ã  pratiquer

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg elsker dig"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="yay EL-sker day"
  example="Phrase essentielle"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er smuk"
  translation="Tu es belle"
  pronunciation="dou Ã¨r smouk"
  example="Compliment basique"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Goddag"
  translation="Bonjour"
  pronunciation="go-DA"
  example="Le 'd' final est doux"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="RÃ¸dgrÃ¸d med flÃ¸de"
  translation="Compote de fruits Ã  la crÃ¨me"
  pronunciation="REUD-greud mÃ¨ FLEU-de"
  example="Le test de prononciation danoise !"
/>

<CultureTip title="Le test 'RÃ¸dgrÃ¸d med flÃ¸de'" flag="ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°">
Â« RÃ¸dgrÃ¸d med flÃ¸de Â» est repute comme le mot le plus difficile Ã  prononcer pour les etrangers. C'est devenu un test amical pour voir si vous maitrisez les sons danois. Votre partenaire vous le fera probablement essayer !
</CultureTip>

## Conseils pour progresser

1. **Ecoutez beaucoup** - Series, podcasts, musique danoise
2. **Imitez les sons** - Repetez aprÃ¨s des locuteurs natifs
3. **Pratiquez Ã†, Ã˜, Ã…** - Ces voyelles sont cles
4. **Adoucissez vos consonnes** - Le danois est une langue Â« douce Â»
5. **Parlez avec votre partenaire** - Demandez des corrections !

<CultureTip title="Les Danois sont patients" flag="ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°">
